<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/14/nfts-bitcoin-spacs-snakers-many-crazes-count?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Too Many Crazes to Count
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/14/nfts-bitcoin-spacs-snakers-many-crazes-count" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Mr. Krabs" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQxL21yX2tyYWJzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Know Your Meme</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You've probably been hearing the words "mania" or "craze" a lot recently when reading about the markets. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sorry—just doing our jobs. As Erin Griffith <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/13/technology/crypto-art-NFTs-trading-cards-investment-manias.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a> in the NYT this weekend, investments in nontraditional corners of the finance industry all seem to be doing this <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> at the very same time. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A short list</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Crypto: </strong>Last March, bitcoin was hovering just above $5,000; on Saturday, it hit an all-time high above $61,000. And dogecoin, a crypto that’s based on a meme, has increased more than 1,100% this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">NFTs: </strong><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/24/nft-frequently-asked-questions?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Non-fungible tokens</a> leverage blockchain technology to let anyone buy an "original copy" of a piece of the internet. Last week, a JPG file sold for $69.3 million at Christie's and bids for Jack Dorsey's OG tweet hit $2.5 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trading cards: </strong>Seven of the 10 most expensive sports trading cards in history have been sold in the past eight months, <a href="https://www.axios.com/newsletters/axios-sports-ac6d995f-b679-4147-b63a-44802a4b3021.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiossports&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Axios Sports</a>. In January, someone bought a 1952 Topps Mickey Mantle for $5.2 million, the highest ever.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">SPACs: </strong>The use of special purpose acquisition companies to take startups public has hit astronomical levels. Of the 302 IPOs so far this year, <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/the-booming-ipo-market-shows-no-signs-of-slowing-what-investors-need-to-know-51615546800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">80% are SPACs</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sneakers: </strong>Last May and June, the e-commerce platform StockX had its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/features/2021-sneaker-investment/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam&stream=top&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">busiest</a> two months since its 2016 launch thanks to exploding interest in the sneaker resale market.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Are they connected? </strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Griffith thinks so. She argues that the pandemic—which wiped calendars clean, boosted many Americans' savings, and made traditional assets like stocks and bonds unattractive—drove bored people to seek out more stimulating (and speculative) ways of deploying their cash.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Plus, it’s not like any of the "crazes" described above are that </span><span><em>new</em></span><span>. SPACs have been around for decades, sneaker-flipping dates back to 1985, and trading cards, well…you get the point. Even NFTs were being developed as early as 2017.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>No one knows exactly if/when any of these "mini-bubbles'' will pop but, at least in the SPAC world, some think it might be soon. The amount wagered on SPACs to <em>fall</em> in value has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/short-sellers-boost-bets-against-spacs-11615714200?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tripled</a> since the start of the year, per the WSJ. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STIMULUS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/14/stimulus-checks-begin-arriving?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When That Stimmy Hits
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/14/stimulus-checks-begin-arriving" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif from an SNL spoof of Drake's "Hotline Bling" showing a dad in a sweater dancing dorkily in a white room" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=373 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26hirHkNLj8CHOwvu/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif from an SNL spoof of Drake's " Hotline Bling" showing a dad in a sweater dancing dorkily in a white room" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26hirHkNLj8CHOwvu/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Adults across the country broke out a rusty Macarena this weekend after seeing the first round of payments under President Biden's stimulus package <a href="https://www.axios.com/covid-stimulus-check-irs-payment-tool-cbf54c7a-a089-42ae-9297-aea109d0611a.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">land</a> in their bank accounts. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the coming weeks, the remaining checks, worth up to $1,400/person, will arrive via deposit, check, or debit card. The IRS told H&R Block that most eligible Americans will receive theirs on Wednesday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who's eligible?</strong> Individuals who earn up to $75,000 and couples who earn $150,000 qualify for full payments. The bill <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2021/03/12/stimulus-checks-irs-says-payments-start-hitting-bank-accounts-weekend/4674379001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expanded</a> the types of dependents eligible to receive a check to include college students, adults with disabilities, and parents or grandparents. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The bill also phases out more quickly compared to December's round of payments, so individuals who earn $80k+ and couples who earn $160k+ won't get a check. The Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy estimates that 8 million fewer people <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-11/stimulus-check-status-8-million-americans-cut-out-of-1-400-stimmy-payments?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">qualify</a> this time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ If you're eligible, use the IRS's <a href="https://www.irs.gov/coronavirus/get-my-payment?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get My Payment</a> tool to see when your check is coming.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/14/grammys-pay-tribute-local-music-venues?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
And the Show Went On
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/14/grammys-pay-tribute-local-music-venues" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Beyonce and Megan These Stallion accepts the award for Best Rap Album at the 63rd Grammy Award outside Staples Center." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Mzg2LzYzcmRfZ3JhbW15X2F3YXJkcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Robert Gauthier/LA Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last night’s 63rd annual Grammy Awards <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/03/14/977035882/2021-grammy-awards-the-full-list-of-winners?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were</a> big for Megan Thee Stallion (best new artist), Billie Eilish (record of the year), and the roughly 60% of the song "WAP" that was allowed to be performed on broadcast television. Plus, history was made: After collecting four new awards for a lifetime total of 28, Beyoncé is now the most decorated artist in Grammy history. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The ceremony also paid tribute to independent music venues hurt by the pandemic, <a href="https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/awards/9539105/2021-grammys-presenters-performers-list/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">featuring</a> bartenders, box-office managers, and other industry workers from iconic venues like Nashville's Station Inn and NYC's Apollo Theater.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Even with vaccines, their situation is grim.</strong> The National Independent Venue Association, which has successfully lobbied the federal government for billions in aid, <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2021/03/12/covid-stimulus-restaurants-bars-live-venues-get-help-reopen/6937794002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a> USA Today, "We were the first to close. We will be the last to open."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To make ends meet during the pandemic, some venues have gotten creative, <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/08/13/901796934/how-live-music-is-coping-and-what-the-near-future-will-bring?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moving</a> performances to outdoor spaces like rooftops, parking lots, and drive-ins. Others have <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/06/arts/music/independent-venues-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supplemented</a> lost revenue with merchandise sales and online crowdfunding. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The loss of beloved entertainment venues not only hurts owners and workers, but the up-and-coming talent they incubate and the local communities whose economies they support.</p>

</h3>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re not talking about you (although judging by your taste in newsletters, you must be a catch). We’re talking about all of the aesthetically pleasing, sleek forms you can make using <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1427610.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25272047.297960876;dc_trk_aid=490983722;dc_trk_cid=147456227;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755};ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Typeform</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With <strong style="color:#000">splashy backgrounds, engaging videos, and high-def photos,</strong> Typeform’s UI brings forms to life in a personalized way that feels like a conversation and less like time spent looking at a screen.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And when folks have a good time flowing through your terrific Typeform, you receive better results. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fed meeting: </strong>On Wednesday, the Fed will release its policy statement and Chair Jerome Powell will take questions following the central bank's two-day meeting. Powell has repeatedly said he's not worried about too-hot economic growth leading to inflation, but the bond market, where yields have been gaining, is sending a different signal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Oscar noms: </strong>We'll find out the nominations for the (very delayed) Academy Awards this morning. For best picture, <em>Nomadland</em>, <em>The Trial of the Chicago 7</em>, <em>Promising Young Woman</em>, <em>Minari</em>, and <em>Mank</em> <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/14/business/media/academy-awards-pandemic-campaigning.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">appear to be locks</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">March Madness: </strong>The first round of the men's NCAA basketball tournament begins on Friday, instead of the typical Thursday (even better excuse to call in sick). The entire tournament is taking place in Indiana this year. <a href="https://www.cbssports.com/college-basketball/news/ncaa-bracket-2021-printable-march-madness-bracket-tournament-field-set-on-selection-sunday/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Here's the bracket</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>St. Patrick's Day is on Wednesday. As you can see above, Chicago is ready to celebrate.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The four-hour "Snyder Cut" of the 2017 film </span><span><em>Justice League </em></span><span>is coming to HBO Max on Thursday.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Saturday marks the official start of spring.</span></li>
</ul>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew’s Greatest Product of All Time tournament got off to a scintillating start last week. Here’s a quick catch-up.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cinderella story: </strong>#14 air fryer toppled #3 TikTok in the Innovators region. Next up? A tussle with the Nike Air Jordan 1 for a spot in the Sweet 16.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Most exciting region: </strong>The Legends bracket is living up to its name. Second-round matchups include Coke vs. Bud Light, Nintendo 64 vs. the Big Mac, and Boeing 747 vs. Monopoly. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Upset watch: </strong>#2 Netflix is going into hostile territory as it takes on #7 Twitter (where the tournament is taking place). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Don’t worry if you missed the action last week. The second round is happening today and you can vote on who should make it into the Sweet 16 on our <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter account</a>. Polls open at 9am ET.</p>

Some all-star states, including Alaska, Massachusetts, and the Dakotas, have given first shots to \u003e 25% of their style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou've probably been hearing the words \"mania\" or \"craze\" a lot recently when reading about the markets. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSorry—just doing our jobs. As Erin Griffith \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/13/technology/crypto-art-NFTs-trading-cards-investment-manias.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e in the NYT this weekend, investments in nontraditional corners of the finance industry all seem to be doing this \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e at the very same time. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA short list\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCrypto: \u003c/strong\u003eLast March, bitcoin was hovering just above $5,000; on Saturday, it hit an all-time high above $61,000. And dogecoin, a crypto that’s based on a meme, has increased more than 1,100% this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNFTs: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/24/nft-frequently-asked-questions?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNon-fungible tokens\u003c/a\u003e leverage blockchain technology to let anyone buy an \"original copy\" of a piece of the internet. Last week, a JPG file sold for $69.3 million at Christie's and bids for Jack Dorsey's OG tweet hit $2.5 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrading cards: \u003c/strong\u003eSeven of the 10 most expensive sports trading cards in history have been sold in the past eight months, \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/newsletters/axios-sports-ac6d995f-b679-4147-b63a-44802a4b3021.html?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiossports\u0026stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Axios Sports\u003c/a\u003e. In January, someone bought a 1952 Topps Mickey Mantle for $5.2 million, the highest ever.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSPACs: \u003c/strong\u003eThe use of special purpose acquisition companies to take startups public has hit astronomical levels. Of the 302 IPOs so far this year, \u003ca href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/the-booming-ipo-market-shows-no-signs-of-slowing-what-investors-need-to-know-51615546800?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e80% are SPACs\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSneakers: \u003c/strong\u003eLast May and June, the e-commerce platform StockX had its \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/features/2021-sneaker-investment/?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam\u0026stream=top\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebusiest\u003c/a\u003e two months since its 2016 launch thanks to exploding interest in the sneaker resale market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAre they connected? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGriffith thinks so. She argues that the pandemic—which wiped calendars clean, boosted many Americans' savings, and made traditional assets like stocks and bonds unattractive—drove bored people to seek out more stimulating (and speculative) ways of deploying their cash.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePlus, it’s not like any of the \"crazes\" described above are that \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003enew\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. SPACs have been around for decades, sneaker-flipping dates back to 1985, and trading cards, well…you get the point. Even NFTs were being developed as early as 2017.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eNo one knows exactly if/when any of these \"mini-bubbles'' will pop but, at least in the SPAC world, some think it might be soon. The amount wagered on SPACs to \u003cem\u003efall\u003c/em\u003e in value has \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/short-sellers-boost-bets-against-spacs-11615714200?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etripled\u003c/a\u003e since the start of the year, per the WSJ. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAdults across the country broke out a rusty Macarena this weekend after seeing the first round of payments under President Biden's stimulus package \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/covid-stimulus-check-irs-payment-tool-cbf54c7a-a089-42ae-9297-aea109d0611a.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eland\u003c/a\u003e in their bank accounts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the coming weeks, the remaining checks, worth up to $1,400/person, will arrive via deposit, check, or debit card. The IRS told H\u0026R Block that most eligible Americans will receive theirs on Wednesday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho's eligible?\u003c/strong\u003e Individuals who earn up to $75,000 and couples who earn $150,000 qualify for full payments. The bill \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2021/03/12/stimulus-checks-irs-says-payments-start-hitting-bank-accounts-weekend/4674379001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpanded\u003c/a\u003e the types of dependents eligible to receive a check to include college students, adults with disabilities, and parents or grandparents. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe bill also phases out more quickly compared to December's round of payments, so individuals who earn $80k+ and couples who earn $160k+ won't get a check. The Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy estimates that 8 million fewer people \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-11/stimulus-check-status-8-million-americans-cut-out-of-1-400-stimmy-payments?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equalify\u003c/a\u003e this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ If you're eligible, use the IRS's \u003ca href=\"https://www.irs.gov/coronavirus/get-my-payment?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGet My Payment\u003c/a\u003e tool to see when your check is coming.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast night’s 63rd annual Grammy Awards \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/03/14/977035882/2021-grammy-awards-the-full-list-of-winners?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere\u003c/a\u003e big for Megan Thee Stallion (best new artist), Billie Eilish (record of the year), and the roughly 60% of the song \"WAP\" that was allowed to be performed on broadcast television. Plus, history was made: After collecting four new awards for a lifetime total of 28, Beyoncé is now the most decorated artist in Grammy history. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe ceremony also paid tribute to independent music venues hurt by the pandemic, \u003ca href=\"https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/awards/9539105/2021-grammys-presenters-performers-list/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efeaturing\u003c/a\u003e bartenders, box-office managers, and other industry workers from iconic venues like Nashville's Station Inn and NYC's Apollo Theater.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEven with vaccines, their situation is grim.\u003c/strong\u003e The National Independent Venue Association, which has successfully lobbied the federal government for billions in aid, \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2021/03/12/covid-stimulus-restaurants-bars-live-venues-get-help-reopen/6937794002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e USA Today, \"We were the first to close. We will be the last to open.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo make ends meet during the pandemic, some venues have gotten creative, \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/13/901796934/how-live-music-is-coping-and-what-the-near-future-will-bring?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emoving\u003c/a\u003e performances to outdoor spaces like rooftops, parking lots, and drive-ins. Others have \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/06/arts/music/independent-venues-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esupplemented\u003c/a\u003e lost revenue with merchandise sales and online crowdfunding. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The loss of beloved entertainment venues not only hurts owners and workers, but the up-and-coming talent they incubate and the local communities whose economies they support.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
